title: Teams review
text:
It taking me a little time getting used to responding to teams we have so many emails and alarms and text messages 
But these guys really help us keep a heads up on what’s going on in the field

title: Microsoft Teams is the best!
text: I really do appreciate my team. This is the best company in the world. I truly appreciate Microsoft!

title: Connectivity issue

title: Great
text: People at Microsoft get it!

title: Messages no longer work through Apple Car Play
text: Teams notifications still pop up on the Car Play screen but you cannot view or hear the messages.  This was not an issue in previous versions of iOS. Please update the app to get this feature back.

title: Team is the best
text: It has good captioning for meetings

title: Once you go Teams, there’s no turning back
text: Teams blows every other solution out of the water. It really should be marketed as consumer alternatives to Zoom as well. Once you’ve used Teams, no other video and chat solution will feel adequate again.

title: Solid app; minor annoyances
text:
Overall the Teams app is very good and I’m glad to use it most of the time. I’ve had only one issue with basic functionality but otherwise it’s been rock-solid.

In terms of issues and annoyances, the biggest issue for me is that my most common use case for using the app is to join the audio of a call I’ve already joined from my laptop. However when I do this, the options Teams presents me with are to transfer the call or join without audio, neither of which do I want to do. So I end up joining a call on my laptop, then joining on my phone and transferring the call (I have to do it in this order due to a Teams platform design issue), then finally re-joining on my laptop. It’s a huge hassle when a simple option to join without either transferring or losing audio (or, better yet, joining audio only) is all I need.

Another behavior of this app I dislike is that it logs call history in the iPhone’s native Phone app. I’m not sure if that’s due to Microsoft or Apple’s call design but it is highly undesirable as I do not like my work matters to bleed into my personal apps on my personal phone. 

The final annoyance is that the volume level is often too high for me, and the ability to control it is restricted. Often I am trying to turn the volume down but it is already at the lowest level my iPhone allows. It seems I am always using the 10-40% volume range, so I’m cramped in my ability to fine-tune loudness as different voices (of varying volume) speak on a call. Even the ability to reduce volume below the lowest iPhone “notch” doesn’t work as the volume just reverts (although this may be an iPhone design issue as well related to calls, but I never feel the volume is too loud in calls). (For what it’s worth, the issue of loudness in Teams calls is also present on my laptop, where I typically keep my volume at somewhere between 2 and 8 out of 100-point scale, with anything over about 35-40 being deafening, so I suspect this is a platform problem just “inherited” by the app.)

There have also been a few bugs, but the only one I was able to replicate consistently was that if I joined a call from my laptop on the web first *without audio*, then joined from my phone, I would not be able to unmute in the mobile app.

All in all, though, this is a pretty good app.

text: The latest version does not allow you to change your status on iPad/tablet

title: Teams works well but the spell checking could be improved.
text: Teams works well but the spell checking could be improved. I like allot of the features of Teams but why Outlook spell checking and punctuation is far superior then in Microsoft Teams I don’t understand, certainly an area of improvement.

title: Teams not available on iwatch watchOS 10.2
text: Why is this no longer available? Thought I had it at one time.

title: Teams freezes up on iPhone
text: I don’t like how much Teams freezes on my iPhone. I keep trying recommend solutions but nothing fixes it.

title: The “fix” broke it
text: The last update caused my teams to no longer ring on my phone. I’ve had to make a mad dash to my office because I could hear it ringing on my desktop but it was not ringing on my cellphones. Notifications are allowed, nothing is turned on for blocking and I’ve reset my device and it still doesn’t ring

title: Desktop shifts different than mobile shifts
text: I have triple checked over the past year. The mobile app will show 2 employees working at the same time, but on my desktop it only shows 1. The desktop is right, but my employees rely on the mobile app. This is very frustrating.

title: Server
text: Would be nice to be in more of a server format. Where you can set specific tags(positions) only allowing them to see what is necessary in the server. Instead of a teams group that has various members/ positions attached that do not correlate directly. I feel like this could be a massive push for Microsoft (Teams). It would allow quicker interactions with better response time.

title: Great way to communicate with others in the office
text: You can call and message co-workers.  It’s a great way to communicate.  I also like the fact you can share your screen with others for demonstrations as well as trouble shooting.

title: OK
text: Pretty good . No complaints.

title: So far so good!
text: Easy to use. The texting feature is awesome! More to come as I have more experience with it…

title: Perfect tool for a small business owner!
text: Thoughtful accessibility, layout, and functionality. Helped me #dobetter for my business, my clients’ businesses, and is helping me defeat our worst enemy TIME!
